io.github.thunderbots.lightning

Class Lightning

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.Lightning

  • public class Lightning
extends java.lang.Object
    The Lightning class exposes methods for general interfacing with the hardware on the physical robot. The static methods in the class can be used for things such as accessing the joysticks, and getting hardware objects.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static LightningOpMode opmode
      The op mode to get joystick information from.
      private static com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap robotHardware
      The HardwareMap that is used as a portal to all hardware on the robot.
      private static com.qualcomm.robotcore.robocol.Telemetry robotTelemetry
      The telemetry link between the robot controller and the driver station.
      private static java.util.List<com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap.DeviceMapping<?>> sensorMaps
      A list of all the DeviceMappings exposed by the hardware map that could point to sensors.
      private static TaskScheduler taskScheduler
      The master task scheduler that is used to execute all background tasks in the SDK and in client code of the SDK.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(LightningOpMode opmode)

        See Also:

      • getJoystick

        public static Joystick getJoystick(int gamepad)
        Gets a reference to the given joystick. Currently, only gamepad1 and gamepad2 are supported.
        Parameters:
        gamepad - the joystick to return; can only be 1 or 2.
        Returns:
        the specified joystick.

      • getMotor

        public static Motor getMotor(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a reference to the motor with the given name.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getSensor

        public static <T> T getSensor(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a reference to any sensor on the robot with the given name. The sensor will need to be type-cast to the expected type of sensor before it can be used in any meaningful way.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the sensor with the given name.

      • sendTelemetryData

        public static void sendTelemetryData(java.lang.String tag,
                                     java.lang.Object data)
        Sends given data from the robot controller to the driver station. Any object can be sent, but the object's toString() method will be called and the string representation of the object is what will actually be sent. The data will be displayed in the bottom portion of the driver station's screen.
        Parameters:
        tag - a very short description of the data that is being sent. Ideally this string should be around 1-8 characters long, but an upper limit on characters is currently not known.
        data - the object to be sent.

      • sendTelemetryData

        public static void sendTelemetryData(java.lang.Object data)
        Sends given data from the robot controller to the driver station. Any object can be sent, but the object's toString() method will be called and the string representation of the object is what will actually be sent. The data will be displayed in the bottom portion of the driver station's screen.
        If this method is used rather than sendTelemetryData(String, Object), the tag for the data will be an empty string.
        Parameters:
        data - the object to be sent.
        See Also:
        sendTelemetryData(String, Object)

      • getSensorMaps

        private static java.util.List<com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap.DeviceMapping<?>> getSensorMaps(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap map)
        Given a HardwareMap, return a list of DeviceMappings that could lead to sensors.
        Parameters:
        map - the hardware map to search for maps in.
        Returns:
        a list of the sensor maps.
